Another way of looking at it is that during the 9 months of pregnancy the fetus is nothing more than a parasite living of it's host & in a constant battle with the hosts immune system.
Sometimes the immune system wins resulting in a miscarriage & sometimes the fetus wins resulting in a baby.
In conclusion then, by right the host should be able to have the parasite removed at any point during the pregnancy. If however it is removed at a point were it is capable of survival outside the hosts body then maybe it should the be given the right to life at that point (but that is a different argument I won't touch on right now)
